w:r.w:t: Updates That Need to Be Modified:

The user interface requires enhancement. Please standardize the font across the platform and reduce the font size to ensure the module appears clean and organized. If there is any uncertainty regarding the UI implementation, kindly share the wireframes for review so that we can select the most suitable design.
The service page should open in full-frame mode. Pop-ups on this page should be eliminated.
Ensure that all relevant variables are included in each section, as some are currently missing.
Tooltips should be added for all variables to improve clarity and usability.
The asset linking process needs refinement. It should be clear where assets can be added and how linked assets can be viewed in relation to the service.
Implement automatic usage metrics. For example, if a keyword is linked to a service, the system should automatically populate the count of how many times the keyword is used for that service.
Variables must be linked to their corresponding master tables. For instance, the Industry ID should be connected to the industry table.
All information should be properly saved and function seamlessly within the workflow.
Please prioritize these updates. We will first thoroughly test the service page before proceeding to subsequent modules.
Make the Description box larger and make in horizontal

w:r.w:t: Upload the asset and select the appropriate repository (e.g., SMM, Content, SEO).
Specify the asset type (Image, Video, Audio), set its status, and enter the mapped services, sub-services, or pages (as listed in the Service Master or Sub-Service Master), then upload the asset.
If the asset is mapped to a service in the Service Master, it should automatically link under that service.
If the asset is mapped to a sub-service, it should automatically link under the corresponding sub-service.
After uploading, the asset will be linked to the relevant service. Users can
search within a specific repository to view a list of assets. From this list, they can select and link the desired asset(s) to the service.
The Asset Library Management section should appear first.
The linking metadata should be displayed based on the Asset Management section.
In the linking metadata, the asset count and sub-service count should be fetched in real-time based on the linking.
If a service is linked with a sub-service, the sub-service count should automatically update to 1.
When I type a letter, its typing under the S.NO
All asset management items and the assets linked to the sub-service should be listed under the Linking section.
All fields available in the service master should also be present in the sub-service master.

, the following fields must be displayed:
, an additional dropdown should appear with individual platforms:
Based on the selected platform, the following fields should be shown separately for each:

Users creating or submitting an asset must complete the following fields in the exact sequence:
– preview option based on the SMM.
– Triggers workflow and sends the asset for approval.

link to a service or sub-service until QC approval is completed.

Full edit access to all required fields.

SEO and Grammar scores are mandatory before submission.
QC list view with summarized fields.
Dedicated QC panel for scoring and remarks.

w:r.w:t: The checklist should change based on the application
Meta title & description optimized with primary keyword
H1, H2 structure correctly applied and keyword-aligned
Image alt text optimized and relevant
Page speed and mobile responsiveness verified
Internal links added and all links functioning
All pages load smoothly without errors
Forms, buttons, and links fully functional
SSL active and no security warnings
Caption aligned with brand tone and error-free
Correct post dimensions (image/video) used for each platform
All links, tags, and CTAs verified and functioning
In the QC list view, the QC team should see a “Review” action.
For the user, the status should display as “Approved,” and the asset should be linked to the respective service.
The submitter fills all fields listed above.
link to a service or sub-service until QC approval is completed.

Introduce a new section under Upload Assets titled “Map Assets to Source Work” and integrate the required variables within this section.
Allows the user to select and link an existing task from the Task module.
Displays all available campaigns for selection and linking.
Lists all projects available in the Project module for linking.
Shows all services from the Service Master for selection.
Displays sub-services related to the selected service.
Allows selection of items from the Repository module to link with the record.
Automatically captures or allows selection of the user who created the record.
Allows selection of the user responsible for designing the content or item.
Displays the current workflow status with the following options:
The List view of Assets page
Allows selection of asset type. Default option:
Categories added in Asset Category master
Displays all campaign categories. Default option:
Lists all services configured in the Service Master. Default option:
Displays sub-services mapped to the selected service. Default option:
Lists all projects available in the system. Default option:
Allows filtering based on asset creator. Lists all system users. Default option:
Enables filtering assets based on a selected date range. Default option:
Displays asset usage states (e.g., Used, Unused, Archived). Default option:
to the Asset Classification with the following dropdown options.
A single dropdown field used to classify the content asset. Available options:
Blog, Service Page, Sub-Service Page, SMM Post, Backlink Asset, Web UI Asset
Based on the Content Type selected during asset
the same Content Type should be fetched and displayed in the List View. The List View must include a dedicated column for Content Type to reflect this information accurately.

The side view must be divided into the following
These fields should also be available as
columns and filters in the Asset List View
Content classification selected during upload (e.g., Article, Blog, SMM Post).
User who last updated the asset.

linkages selected while uploading the asset

Data Source: Asset Upload → “Map Assets to Source Work” section

render in the asset side view
searchable and filterable in the Asset List View

where and how the asset is used

→ Asset details must open in a

Admin users are responsible for performing QC checks. They will review the asset, assign a QC score through the QC panel, and submit the QC results. Once the asset passes QC, it should be automatically linked to the corresponding Service page.
If an asset is marked as
during QC, it should be clearly indicated as
in the user view. The user will then make the necessary updates and resubmit the asset for QC review.
We do not require a separate QC mode. Once an asset is submitted
and send to Asset to QC stage
it should automatically move to the
After it moved to the QC review:
Displays a small preview image of the asset. Should load from the stored asset thumbnail URL.
Name of the asset entered during asset upload. Should be clickable to open the asset side-view panel.
Displays the asset type (e.g., Banner, Video, Document) selected during upload.
Shows the asset category mapped in the Asset Category Master.
Displays the selected content type (e.g., Blog, Service Page, SMM Post) chosen during asset upload.
Shows the service mapped to the asset under “Map Assets to Source Work.”
Displays the task linked to the asset (if mapped during upload).
Indicates the current QC state (e.g., Pending, Pass, Fail, Rework). Should update dynamically based on QC actions.
Displays the current version of the asset (e.g., v1.0, v1.2).
Shows the designer or creator assigned during asset upload or workflow configuration.
Displays the asset upload date and time. Should follow system date-time format.
Indicates the number of times the asset is used or referenced across services, pages, or campaigns.
Provides actions such as View, Send to QC, Rework, or Approve, based on user role and asset status.
Since the Linked Sub-Service is already available under Map Asset to Source Work, please remove the
option, the fields are currently unorganized. Only the fields that were originally entered for the selected asset type should be editable.
